intro: Pedicularis comosa var. erythraea, commonly known as the red-hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
